messages: a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (23:14): Doesn't the argument translate into the HTML serialization itself (in its least XMLish forms) being inaccessible?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (23:15): a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9: you are onto the secret conspiracy!
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (23:15): I wonder if Algol 68 semicolon omission could be used to justify tag omission...
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (23:18): e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0: Your HTML source is inaccessible!
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (23:19): teh doctype tag isn't future proff
150ca666565bfcb850b2e2ee3c0f0c64 (23:19): he's using a different definition of "accessible" than some of the people arguing with him are, I think
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (23:19): which HTML source?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (23:19): e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0: the diff doc
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (23:20): I don't control the output of Bert's script
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (23:20): Could you pass it through an extra script?
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (23:20): are we debating that now on public-html?
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (23:20): hasn't read e-mail
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (23:20): (like Tidy, I guess)
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (23:21): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: shouldn't a person with low vision or attention problems run the extra script him/herself?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (23:21): http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/public-html/2007Jul/0406.html
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (23:21): e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0: public-html is fun, isn't it
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (23:22): oh, whatever
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (23:22): i for one, like the output of the script...
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (23:23): I mean if I had a problem with reading code with the GNU brace style, shouldn't I be the one who runs a One True Brace Style reindenter?

0c2de4934c6d7fc96160344dec846df3 (23:23): thinks public-html has horrible accessibility, as the volume of messages is too large for slow readers to keep up. (That falls under accessibility, right?) :)
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (23:23): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: No, the GNU brace style is a crime against humanity.
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (23:25): 0c2de4934c6d7fc96160344dec846df3: I wonder how the users of aural email clients keep up

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (23:27): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: That assumes the person with low vision or attention problems is vaguely technically competent, which appears to be disagree with the assumption that they will get highly confused by reading valid HTML4 code
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:28): I have no issue with how the document is formatted, though I'd do it differently myself
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (23:29): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: does it disagree with them reading markup source in the first place?
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (23:31): I guess nobody noticed the html5 spec is formatted in exactly the same way?
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (23:31): and XMLHttpRequest, and access-control and selectors-api and xbl and the list goes on
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (23:31): (all CSS specs)

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (23:31): I would expect the number of people reading the source code of a W3C document in order to learn HTML while having some disability and being harmed by it not looking enough like XML, is somewhat negligible
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:32): e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0: but this is a W3C HTML WG Note!
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:32): (yes, that is the best reason I can come up with)
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (23:32): e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0: Maybe they're all looking at the multipage version, which does have quotes and closing tags everywhere? :-)
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (23:32): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: an Editor's Draft of one
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (23:32): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c, yeah... about that... :p
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (23:33): the interesting thing is that they all complain but nobody brings up actual problems or solutions
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (23:33): they're not very productive and just wasting everyone's time
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (23:34): well, at least I don't need to read thedailywtf to get a daily fix anymore...
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (23:34): Maybe we should apply for a column on the site
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (23:35): a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 - new mailing list ... public-html-wtf
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (23:35): all that nonsense hides the useful commit logs from hixie!
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (23:36): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: Web Task Force, perhaps?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (23:36): Trick people into thinking it's actually worth posting there, and then everyone else can ignore them
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (23:39): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: You mean http://whattf.org/ :)
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (23:40): a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9: no, whattf is useful (hopefully :-)
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (23:42): tells people to talk to Bert Bos
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (23:44): Is http://wiki.whatwg.org/ dead?

a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (23:47): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c - public-html-elite ... "Dear [recipient], Your ideas posted recently to the HTML working group have been deemed to be of such an advanced quality of insight that we believe they merit discussion on a special mailing list, away from all the boring mundane scary technical mumbo-jumbo for which public-html is intended. Welcome and congratulations."
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (23:47): :p
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (23:50): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: not dead. edited yesterday
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (23:51): I just get "Connection refused" messages :-(
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (23:52): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: oh yeah, it is that kind of dead
